title: Drawing, "Project for a sauce boat", 1827–35
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper
signed: Signed in black ink, lower right: J. Seethaler
inscribed: Inscribed in reddish ink, lower right: [partial number]
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Shown from side. The handle formed by a winged mermaid is at right. A grapevine rinceau grows from the fishtail leg. Oblong plinth alternatively suggested with or without leaf shapes on moldings. Supported by lion feet with shells and leaf scrolls.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a sauce boat", 1827–35.
1827–35. Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-342.
